alert.note: Alert for Mitchell; Yancey (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 03 at 8:56AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Mitchell and Yancey Counties in western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 853 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated ongoing moderate to heavy rain showers streaming repeatedly from eastern Tennessee across the northern mountains of western North Carolina. Radar and rain gauges indicated 1 to 2 inch rainfall totals over the past three hours, with additional rainfall rates of one-half to three quarters of an inch per hour expected through at least late morning. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ramseytown, Poplar, Green Mountain, Buladean, Swiss and Wolf Ridge. Flooding is most likely along and near Deer Branch, the Nolichucky River, and Hollow Poplar Creek. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
